Title: Series: Fasti di Napoleone
Description: Plate 16: Bonaparte's Egyptian campaign showing him meditating on the sad condition of France; he is seen standing on the left, looking thoughtful as the personification of France appears before him, surrounded by suffering children, with discarded attributes of the arts and cornucopia scattered at their feet Engraving
Curator's comments: For comment on series see 1872,0113.684.1 This is the third of five plates on the Egyptian campaign. See "Mito e storia nei 'Fasti di Napoleone' di Andrea Appiani", Rome, 1986, n.xvi.
Associated names: Representation of: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Associated events: Associated Event: Napoleon's campaign in Egypt 1798-1799
